intro: Echites veraguasensis, commonly known as the Veraguas spurge, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a rough texture. Echites veraguasensis is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
